DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the effects of two intrathecally administered drugs:0.5% levobupivacaine and0.75%Ropivacaine in spinal anesthesia
DOC.brief_title: Spinal Anaesthesia With Levobupivacaine 0.5% and Ropivacaine 0.75% for Lower Limb Orthopaedic Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Bupivacaine is a highly cardiotoxic drug and also produces prolonged motor blockade.The newer drugs levobupivacaine and ropivacaine being comparatively less cardio and neurotoxic are preferred now a days.So, we conducted this prospective, randomized double blind study with an aim of comparing the efficacy and characteristics of these drugs.
DOC.criteria: 1. American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) class I & II patients of either sex 2. Age between 1860 years 1. Patient's refusal. 2. Patients who have contraindications to spinal anaesthesia / Local anaesthetic drugs. 3. Patients having h/o diabetes, neurological and musculoskeletal diseases.
